page.title: 05Tresaith, Dyfed - Tourism
page.content: The edge of{Tresaith}village comes into this area. Tourism makes an important contribution to the economy and{employment}of local people. Nearby caravan sites are popular, and many local farmers have holiday cottages or accommodation, or provide bed and breakfast for visitors. Local shops benefit from extra custom, and farms sell eggs and vegetable produce to supplement their income from agriculture. Unspoilt countryside with a varied collection of{wild flowers,}and attractive cliff {walks}are popular, and nearby beaches attract{families with younger {children.}The{National Trust}looks after a substantial area of coast centring on nearby{Penbryn.
